'Elsevier B.V.' () is a publishing company which publishes medical and
scientific literature. It is a part of the Reed Elsevier group. Based in
Amsterdam, the company has operations in the United Kingdom, USA, and elsewhere.

Leading products include journals such as [[The Lancet]] and [[Cell
(journal)|Cell]], books such as [[Gray's Anatomy]], the ScienceDirect collection
of electronic journals, the [[Trends (journals)|Trends]] and [[Current Opinion]]
series of journals, and the online citation database Scopus. Its free researcher
collaboration tool, 2collab, launched in 2007, was discontinued in 2011.

Elsevier publishes 250,000 articles a year in 2,000 journals. "[http://www.elsevier.com/wps/find/intro.cws_home/ataglance
Elsevier at a glance]". Elsevier. Its archives contain seven million
publications. Total yearly downloads amount to 240
million. "[http://www.elsevier.com/wps/find/intro.cws_home/glance_1 Journal
publishing at Elsevier]". Elsevier. Retrieved 3 September 2011. The
company is currently being boycotted by academics who object to its business
model, which includes "paywalls" and excessively high subscription charges.
